Quick tour

Take a look at the basics of Tweakpane in minutes.

{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Inputs

Use addInput() to add a control to modify parameter values.

const PARAMS = {
  factor: 123,
  title: 'hello',
  color: '#0f0',
};

const pane = new Tweakpane();

pane.addInput(PARAMS, 'factor');
pane.addInput(PARAMS, 'title');
pane.addInput(PARAMS, 'color');

Some kinds of inputs accept additional parameters:

const PARAMS = {
  percentage: 50,
  theme: 'dark',
};

// `min` and `max`: slider
pane.addInput(
  PARAMS, 'percentage',
  {min: 0, max: 100, step: 10}
);

// `options`: list
pane.addInput(
  PARAMS, 'theme',
  {options: {Dark: 'dark', Light: 'light'}}
);

See Inputs section or API reference for details.

Folders

You can organize multiple controls with folders.

const f = pane.addFolder({
  title: 'Title',
  expanded: true,
});

f.addInput(PARAMS, 'text');
f.addInput(PARAMS, 'size');

If you want to expand/collapse the whole pane, specify title option of the pane.

const pane = new Tweakpane({
  title: 'Parameters',
  expanded: true,
});

In addition to this, Tweakpane has several useful UI components. See UI components section for details.

Events

You can handle change events by on() of the input.

const input = pane.addInput(
  PARAMS, 'size',
  {min: 8, max: 100, step: 1}
);

input.on('change', function(value) {
  console.log(`change: ${value}`);
});

Tweakpane also provides a way to handle global events that are for all components.

Presets

Tweakpane has a support for exporting/importing parameter values in JSON format. Call exportPreset() to export the current state.

btn.on('click', function() {
  const preset = pane.exportPreset();
  console.log(preset);
});

Also want to know about importing feature? Interactive demo is available for this case.

Monitors

Tweakpane provides a way to monitor value changes. Use addMonitor() to add a monitor component.

pane.addMonitor(sketch, 'signal', {
  view: 'graph',
  interval: 200,
  min: -1,
  max: +1,
});

See Monitors section for full features.
